text: Dmitry Golitsyn (1915) Prince Dmitry Petrovich Golitsyn (1860–1928) was a Russian writer, politician and public figure. He was the leader of the Russian Assembly, a right-wing political group opposed to westernisation, and advocated 'Autocracy, Orthodoxy and Nationality'.Figes, p. 196 ==References== ==Bibliography== * Category:Russian Empire Category:1860 births Category:1928 deaths
title: Dmitri Petrovich Golitsyn
